results.title: Fremantle, first port in Australia
results.creator_credit: Les Bambury and Fremantle Port Authority
results.brief_description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.
results.description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.

results.title: Fremantle cray fishers
results.brief_description: The departure of the cray fishing boats from Fremantle, Western Australia, in the early morning to the fishing grounds in the deep water. These hard working fishermen work a twelve hour day and are dependent on the weather and the mood of the sea for a good season. After the long day they return to port with their catch.

results.title: Friluft: 'The call of the open-air'
results.creator_credit: Jorgen Roos, Dansk Kulturfilm and Minerva Films
results.brief_description: A lighthearted historical cross-section of the open air movement. This film covers outdoor sports/recreation activities throughout Danish history, commenting that Danes first started the scout movement in 1909 and the Youth Hostel movement in 1930 for example. Increasing urbanisation in the cities resulted in society becoming more inward, preferring to stay indoors rather than being sporty as their ancestors once were. As female clothing became freer, along with loosening social mores, people began to go outdoors once more. Chiefly based on original historical material-paintings, engravings, photographs and old films, contrasting with the final live action sequence of present-day. Danish language with English sub-titles. Music by Bent Fabricius-Bjerre and written by Tork Haxthausen.

results.title: Freedom to read
results.creator_credit: Julian Roffman, Erik Barnouw and Center for Mass Communication of Columbia University
results.brief_description: A discussion film dealing with the problem of censorship as it affects the public library. Dramatized incidents are used in presenting opposing points of view and in raising questions regarding the role of the Library in a democratic country.

results.title: Freedom of the press
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An historical review of freedom of the press in America from Zenger’s weekly journal to the publication of today’s newspapers. The film covers one news story (President Truman’s tax proposal) to metropolitan, small town and rural newspapers. Differentiates between news reporting and editorialising.

results.title: Freedom from dust
results.brief_description: Surveys the problem of industrial air and water pollution, and the difficulties of effective waste disposal. Shows the instruments which are used to measure pollution in industrial areas, and the various possible measures to prevent or alleviate it.

results.title: Free to roam
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Stuart Legg and Strand Film Zoological Productions
results.brief_description: At Whipsnade Zoo, 35 miles from London, there is an unusual zoo; a great expanse of English downland is reserved for animals to roam as they do in their native habitats. To the reserve come naturalists and zoologists from many countries, for on these 500 acres of English soil, animal life from all over the world may be studied. The film makes use of interesting natural sound.

results.title: Free to move (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Lewis, Derek Monk, Ted Channell, Schools Council and Southern Films
results.brief_description: Attempts to show that physical education is concerned with the education of the whole child, not only his physical well being. Shows need for a broad based and varied programme of activities; and how related work in other areas of the curriculum may spring from or lead to work in movement. Presents a composite picture of the balanced programme offered in a good primary school.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Lewis, Derek Monk, Ted Channell, Schools Council and Southern Films
